SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

org.nebularis.defproxy.annotations
Annotation Type ProxyArguments

@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=METHOD)
public @interface ProxyArguments

Provides annotations for passing additional string arguments to a ProxyDelegated method in order to modify the parameter array during dynamic dispatch. In the following example, the barcode method is mapped to an underlying delegate get which takes an argument naming an attribute you wish to retrieve. 

 @ProxyInterface(delegate = HashMap.class)
 public interface Item {

      @ProxyDelegated(methodName = "get")
      @ProxyArguments(value = {"bar-code"})
      String barcode();

 }
The optional direction() property indicates the end of the formal argument list, to which the additional parameters should be added (i.e., prepend or append them). It's default value of ProxyArguments.Direction.Prefix indicates that the additional arguments will be passed in front of any explicitly provided arguments.

Optional Element Summary
 ProxyArguments.Direction direction
          The direction in which to fix additional arguments to the existing parameter list.
 String[] value
          An array of string arguments to add to the passed parameter list.
 

value

public abstract String[] value
An array of string arguments to add to the passed parameter list.

Returns:
Default:
{}

direction

public abstract ProxyArguments.Direction direction
The direction in which to fix additional arguments to the existing parameter list.

Returns:
Default:
org.nebularis.defproxy.annotations.ProxyArguments.Direction.Prefix
